t: Proverbs 23
Saying 7
When*pn you sit to dine with a ruler, note*ld well what is before you,
and*ln put a knife to your throat if*ld you are given to gluttony.
Do*ln not crave his delicacies, for*ld that food is deceptive.
Saying 8
Do*pn not wear yourself out to get rich; do*ld not trust your own cleverness.
Cast*ln but a glance at riches, and they are gone, for*ld they will surely sprout wings and*ld fly off to the sky like an eagle.
Saying 9
Do*pn not eat the food of a begrudging host, do*ld not crave his delicacies;
for*ln he is the kind of person who*ld is always thinking about the cost. “Eat*ln and drink,” he says to you, but*ld his heart is not with you.
You*ln will vomit up the little you have eaten and*ld will have wasted your compliments.
Saying 10
Do*pn not speak to fools, for*ld they will scorn your prudent words.
Saying 11
Do*pn not move an ancient boundary stone or*ld encroach on the fields of the fatherless,
for*ln their Defender is strong; he*ld will take up their case against you.
Saying 12
Apply*pn your heart to instruction and*ld your ears to words of knowledge.
Saying 13
Do*pn not withhold discipline from a child; if*ld you punish them with the rod, they will not die.
Punish*ln them with the rod and*ld save them from death.
Saying 14
My*pn son, if your heart is wise, then*ld my heart will be glad indeed;
my*ln inmost being will rejoice when*ld your lips speak what is right.
Saying 15
Do*pn not let your heart envy sinners, but*ld always be zealous for the fear of the Lord.*s
There*ln is surely a future hope for you, and*ld your hope will not be cut off.
Saying 16
Listen,*pn my son, and be wise, and*ld set your heart on the right path:
Do*ln not join those who drink too much wine or*ld gorge themselves on meat,
for*ln drunkards and gluttons become poor, and*ld drowsiness clothes them in rags.
Saying 17
Listen*pn to your father, who gave you life, and*ld do not despise your mother when she is old.
Buy*ln the truth and do not sell it— wisdom,*ld instruction and insight as well.
The*ln father of a righteous child has great joy; a*ld man who fathers a wise son rejoices in him.
May*ln your father and mother rejoice; may*ld she who gave you birth be joyful!
Saying 18
My*pn son, give me your heart and*ld let your eyes delight in my ways,
for*ln an adulterous woman is a deep pit, and*ld a wayward wife is a narrow well.
Like*ln a bandit she lies in wait and*ld multiplies the unfaithful among men.
Saying 19
Who*pn has woe? Who has sorrow? Who*ld has strife? Who has complaints? Who*ld has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes?
Those*ln who linger over wine, who*ld go to sample bowls of mixed wine.
Do*ln not gaze at wine when it is red, when*ld it sparkles in the cup, when*ld it goes down smoothly!
In*ln the end it bites like a snake and*ld poisons like a viper.
Your*ln eyes will see strange sights, and*ld your mind will imagine confusing things.
You*ln will be like one sleeping on the high seas, lying*ld on top of the rigging.
“They*ln hit me,” you will say, “but I’m not hurt! They*ld beat me, but I don’t feel it! When*ln will I wake up so*ld I can find another drink?”
